dt: {bc}to contaminate with a disease-producing substance or agent (such as bacteria)
{bc}to communicate a pathogen or a disease to
{bc}to invade (an individual or organ) usually by penetration
{bc}to become transmitted and copied to (a device, such as a computer)

dt.t: the inflated writing that {wi}infects{/wi} such stories

dt: {bc}to work upon or seize upon so as to induce sympathy, belief, or support

dt.t: trying to {wi}infect{/wi} their salespeople with their enthusiasm

et: Middle English {it}infecten, enfecten{/it} "to inflict with disease, pollute, damage, corrupt," borrowed from Latin {it}infectus,{/it} past participle of {it}inficere{/it} "to dye, discolor, impregnate, taint, contaminate with disease," from {it}in-{/it} {et_link|in-:2|in-:2} + {it}facere{/it} "to make, bring about, perform, do" {ma}{mat|fact|}{/ma}
shortdef: to contaminate with a disease-producing substance or agent (such as bacteria)
to communicate a pathogen or a disease to
to invade (an individual or organ) usually by penetration

dt: {bc}concurrent infection of a cell or organism with two or more {d_link|pathogenic|pathogenic} agents

utxt.t: Some experts suspect that {d_link|superspreaders|super-spreader} might have a more virulent strain of coronavirus or be {wi}co-infected{/wi} with other microbes.

shortdef: concurrent infection of a cell or organism with two or more pathogenic agents
